Best eggdrop soup I've had.   Everything was very fresh and had great flavor.   The fact they  deliver sealed the deal.
The food was fresh and tasty!  I would say it was my favorite WonTon soup ever!  We'll be back!

Excellent! I travel the US quite a bit. I always use Yelp to search for the best Chinese food. This place was closest to the hotel so I gave it a shot. Glad I did. I always order the same dish, Happy Family. It is veggies and every meat you can think of. Chicken, beef, shrimp, scallops etc.... I ordered it to go. It was done in less than 7 minutes and was piping hot. A short 1.5 mile trip back to the Doubletree and I was ready for dinner. Very good. Veggies still crisp, not mushy. I also gauge the quality by the oil content. Not oily at all. I was satisfied with the quality, taste and value. I will return!

This is my to go to Chinese restaurant here in Gilbert area. I have been coming here for years ever since I moved here of 2011. My fave dishes from them is the Lo Mein and salt/pepper shrimp. I love that they dont use msg in their dishes and they use low cholesterol oil to cook their food. The flavors in their dishes are so delish and portions are pretty decent size. I never get tired of going here everytime I crave Chinese. The people are also friendly so thats a plus. Its a small place but they tend to get pretty busy with their regulars. A must try if youre nearby!

This place is pretty decent. It's one of our stand-bys for when we don't feel like cooking. From the time we order to the time the food is done is usually about 10 mins. The food is consistently ok, never bad, but nothing to be excited about. We order the lemon chicken for the kids, because they don't like anything spicy. Food for four people usually lasts about 1 1/2 meals for us and costs around $40 for a couple of chicken and rice dishes and some potstickers/crab puffs.

Very pleased with my visit here. I called in around 730 pm to pick up. It took only ten minutes for my entire order (fried rice, shrimp lo mein, and orange chicken). I got in and out of the establishment within 5 minutes. While the food was fantastic I might also add that the portion sizes were huge. Will definitely be spending my money here again.

Try somewhere else. I normally enjoy supporting family owned/ran businesses, so it is unfortunate I have to write this. My family have been going here for years and it has gotten worse at each visit. Two recent visits, the most recent was dine in and the service was horrible. Worse than when we called our order and picked up the food. So, if you want to be treated like they are doing you a favor by cooking an over priced meal then by all means, head over to J&K Gourmet on 2540 S Val Vista Rd in Gilbert AZ! They will provide poor service and act as if their job is to socialize with each other at the counter and if something was made wrong or is horrible they will make sure to act as if it was your mistake and look at you like you're an idiot. And to get a refill even on water, well you should just bring your own drinks since they will only be at your table four times. 1) to seat you; 2) take your order; 3) bring your food and 4) bring the bill. Anyway, you more than like will see a young girl who thinks she is one of your own teenage kids with the attitudes she gives. Good luck and with all the other Chinese food places around, try somewhere else.

Ordered takeout from here last night - orange chicken, Mongolian beef, fried rice and crab wontons. The rice, orange chicken and Mongolian beef were to die for but the crab rangoons were nothing special. Food was ready and piping hot when I picked it up about 15 minutes after ordering over the phone. Staff was very friendly. Although I didn't dine in, the atmosphere in the restaurant was pleasant and clean. I will be back!

I ordered the Mongolian Beef and Sweet and Sour Chicken last week. The Mongolian Beef was pretty good, but their Sweet and Sour was just nasty! The breading tasted like old fryer oil from the 60's..EW!  

I picked up this food because I was in the area, but live in the West Valley, so when I called to tell them about their chicken, she said I had to drive back over there, which is an hr drive and return the food in order for them to do anything about it. I told the manager my situation and she did not care, not even to lose my business. She quote on quote said to me, "too bad for you" LOL w/e

I had to throw practically all of the order of Sweet and Sour away. You won't be getting my business anymore!

Always great service, consistent quality and delicious!!! We always order take out from J&K even though it is 15 minutes away from our house. Kung Pao Beef and Hunan Beef were so yummy and spicy my husband and I needed two beers each to cool our mouths down. The servings are so large you have an amazing lunch the next day.

Some of the best Chinese food we've had in Arizona. Not too greasy or fake tasting. Very balanced. Good portions. House fried rice and teriyaki chicken were very good. Will be coming back to try rest of menu.
This place gives you a lot of food for your money. Good food too. Love the honey chicken and delivery is always faster than what they quote you!

I love good Chinese food, and this place is my favorite for it in the valley. Whenever I'm down in the area, I try to swing by and get some. The place is always just about full, which, in my experience, is rare for a Chinese food restaurant. If you're in the area, you should definitely try this place out.

For some reason I was craving and in search for fried pork. Who hasn't had that craving before, right? I was lucky to come across J&K and saw a picture that someone posted of their salt and pepper pork. I immediately headed there for lunch and ordered it...wish it was part of their lunch special but oh well. They have a huge menu and there were so many tempting things but I just had have some fried pork. It was exactly what I was looking for and did not disappoint. It had the right amount of saltiness and the sauteed jalapeno slices, onions and bell peppers were the perfect accompaniment. I can't wait to bring the rest of my family so I can try what they order and get the salt & pepper pork again.
I love their food. I've never had a bad dish! Great service and super fast with take out! Great place to indulge!

We went to this place because several mentioned it was the best place in this area. I don't know where they have eaten but this was absolutely the worse place we have eaten. My husband and I had the combo plate with wontons, egg roll, soup, etc. I had Mongolian Beef and the only thing good was the sauce. It is usually made with green onions but they had mostly white onions and I picked out, at least, 1 1/4 cups of them. I don't really know what the "beef"was but it was the color of white meat chicken and had kind of a mushy texture and tasted nothing like beef. The wontons were not good and the egg roll was tasteless. Even the hot mustard didn't help. The hot and sour soup was your typical pre made variety. My husband had the cashew chicken and said it was tasteless except for the sauce. He said if he had not been so hungry he would not have eaten it. If you have ever had really good Chinese food, don't go here. If you don't know what Chinese food is supposed to taste like, you may like it.

I will say the servers were very nice and did tell me if I came back to tell them not to put all the onions in the beef so they are accommodating. Unfortunately, we won't be going back.
Ordered here plenty of times. Best chinese in my opinion. Garlic chicken and honey chicken. Hands down best in gilbert

Very disappointed. Saw the good reviews so we decided to try J&K Gourmet last night. Appetizer and food was OK, not great. Waited on by three different women. Part of our order came out wrong. Did not enjoy the atmosphere, food or experience.

Horrible customer service.  I just called for a delivery and gave him my order, he laughed and said, "that isn't enough for deliver".  I asked, ok what is the minimum?.. he laughed again and said $25.  We went back and fourth because I was trying to figure out how much my total was at that point. He was just completely rude so I ended up not even ordering anything. He could have easily, and politely, told me that there was a $25 minimum for any deliver.

Food was terrible... Granted, we came at 4 pm so I'm sure it was left over from lunch. Still, 13 dollars for an appetizer platter for two should have more than just 2 of 5 items. Bad service, horrid overcooked ribs and their prices are far too high for the quality of food that they serve. Still, we paid our bill and decided to warn people that are looking for a decent Chinese restaurant... Don't go here.

We live nearby and have been here several times.  My wife gets a few different dishes (including kung pao) and I always get the gang pang chicken.  Huge portions, steaming hot, perfectly prepared.  The potstickers are huge and really good.

We tried the chicken wings once -- meh.  There's a spice/herb/seasoning in there that neither of us cared for.

Beer selection is limited, but I guess ya gotta go with a Tsing Tao anyway.

I recommend this place.

Oh, and the owners/staff are awesome.

I love this place!!! I get take out or delivery from here almost every week....yes I said delivery, any order over $20 and they'll bring it right to you! Such a relief after a long day of work and doorbell rings with some fried rice and orange chicken mmmmm buddy and the dinner combinations for 1 are a great deal for a lot of food!
